result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin J. Hardy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Richland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programs or therapy as required by agent (cognitive thinking or anger management or any other program as recommended).

Must pursue high school diploma.

Expungement is to be afford, upon successful completion of probation, per 973.015.  Defendant to follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding that procedure when the time comes.

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: With work release/huber and 25 days credit.  Costs still owed; judgment until paid.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

RCSD Dispo of Warrant or Commitment

Appearances by ADA Forehand for the State and by Def, in custody, with Atty. C Ritter for the Defense.  Agent's recommendation is for 45 days jail.  ADA addresses the Court.  Atty. Ritter addresses the Court.  Court orders 45 days jail.  Atty. R states def has been in custody since June 24th; notes def sat 3 other days; total credit requested is 25 days.  So ordered.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 07-15-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Dillan L. Hardy in court with attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. L states the parties' agreement for resolution:  Def to plead no contest to dc charge for 12 mo probation with conditions of costs, cognitive thinking, anger mgt, pursuit of hs diploma or equiv., expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.

Court withholds sentence for 12 mo probation.  Conditions:  Pay costs, attend/pay for/and succ. complete any programs or therapy as required by agent.  Cognitive thinking or anger management or any other program as recommended by agent.  Must pursue h.s. diploma.  

Expungement upon successful completion of probation per 973.015.

* Court dismisses confidential case matters on conditions that def attend school and get his diploma.
Defendant's ... for Attorney to Appear and Act

Attorney Adrian Wayne Longacre in court for Defendant Calvin J. Hardy by authorization to appear. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court asks Atty. L where his client is.  Atty. L states he's tried to call def and received no answer.  Atty. L states he has gone over the complaint with his client; enters NG plea on his behalf.  Court resets this case and all others pending against Mr. Hardy for April 1st at 2:30.  Def is ordered to appear.  Status conference scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

ADA Forehand for the State. Def appears via telephone from LaCrosse Secure Detention. Atty Adrian Longacre appears in person for defendant. Atty Longacre requests matter be setover until def is released. Set for 03/19/15 @ 4.

Defendant Calvin J. Hardy not in court. Atty Longacre appears on behalf of def. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA request matter be reset, requests warrant but stayed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.
